articles.title: Friendship gathering with Cuban Embassy officials
articles.content:
Friendship gathering with Cuban Embassy officials
   Pyongyang, March 20 (KCNA) -- A friendship gathering with Cuban Ambassador to Korea Jose Ramon Rodriguez Varona and Embassy officials took place on the Korea-Cuba Friendship Hwasong Cooperative Farm in a suburb of Pyongyang on Wednesday.
   The guests looked round the monument to the great leader President Kim Il Sung's on-site guidance and helped farmers in their work.
   They sang songs and conversed with farmers, deepening feelings of friendship.

articles.title: Work of President Kim Il Sung published in Ukraine
articles.content:
Work of President Kim Il Sung published in Ukraine
   Pyongyang, March 20 (KCNA) -- A famous work of the great leader President Kim Il Sung "Let Us Achieve the Great Unity of Our Nation" was published in booklet by the Ibers Publishing House of Ukraine on Mar. 13 on the occasion of his 85th birth anniversary.
   The director of the publishing house said that the work fully reflects the tireless efforts made by the president for the reunification of Korea in his lifetime. 
   The policy for the great unity of the nation expounded in the work is the wisest, he said, adding: we are sure that the Korean people will get united to put an end to outside interference and unfailingly achieve the reunification of the country.

articles.title: Stamps and envelops on 80th anniversary of KNA
articles.content:
Stamps and envelops on 80th anniversary of KNA
   Pyongyang, March 20 (KCNA) -- The Ministry of Post and Telecommunications brought out commemorative stamps and envelops on the threshold of the 80th anniversary of the Korean National Association.
   Among them is a set of stamps which carry a poem "The green pine on mt. Nam" written by Kim Yong Jik, an indomitable revolutionary fighter, and a picture of a strong pine tree remaining green even in winter.
   Another stamp carries letters "Aim High" and "1917-1997" depicting sunrays shining all over the world against the background of the monument to the formation of the Korean National Association which conveys the undying feats of Kim Hyong Jik 
who brought a new turn in the development of the Korean anti-Japanese national-liberation movement by forming the KNA, the first anti-Japanese underground revolutionary organization.
   The Ministry printed an envelop with a picture of the monument to the Pisok-gye (stone monument association).

articles.title: Preparations for 85th birthday of President Kim Il Sung abroad
articles.content:
Preparations for 85th birthday of President Kim Il Sung abroad
   Pyongyang, March 20 (KCNA) -- The Central Secretariat of the Pakistan People's Party and the Pakistan-Korea friendship Association respectively met on Mar. 11 and 12 to inaugurate preparatory committees for events to mark the 85th birth anniversary of the great leader President Kim Il Sung.
   Nazar Hussain Kiyani, Head of the Secretariat, and Zafar Bakhtawari, Chairman of the Association, were nominated for the chairmanships of the committees at the meetings.
   They said in their speeches that events would be held across the country on the occasion of April 15.
   A month of commemoration was set at the meetings.
   A Ugandan preparatory committee was inaugurated in Kampala to mark this anniversary. Baguma Isoke, Minister of State for Natural Resources, was appointed Chairman of the committee. 
   The period from Mar. 13 to Apr. 18 was set as a month of commemoration and the action program was discussed at the meeting.

articles.title: "ANSP" accused of trying to disintegrate student movement
articles.content:
"ANSP" accused of trying to disintegrate student movement
   Pyongyang, March 20 (KCNA) -- The north headquarters of the national alliance of youth and students for the country's reunification on March 19 published a statement to denounce the south Korean puppet "agency for national security planning" (ANSP) for its vicious operations to disintegrate the federation of university student councils.  
   The statement says:
   Some university student councils in south Kyongsang province, south Korea, seceded from the federation allegedly to "find a new way of student movement" such as improvement of educational conditions, promotion of welfare and public service activities. this was a result of the operations of the "ANSP." 
   The "ANSP" has worked hard to disintegrate the federation from within by means of police repression and bribery. 
   The statement expresses support and solidarity for the just cause of the federation and urges the south Korean students to be on the alert against the moves of undermining the federation and never to be involved in such moves.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun on Japan's design for overseas expansion
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun on Japan's design for overseas expansion 
Pyongyang, March 20 (KCNA) -- Some time ago, Director-
General of the Defence Agency of Japan Fumio Kyuma said at the Budgetary  Committee Meeting of the House of Councillors that the Japanese government is examining how to support the overseas-based U.S. forces.
   Branding his remark as an expression of Japan's ill-intentioned design for overseas expansion, a news analyst of Rodong Sinmun today says:
   Iit is an invariable ambition of the Japanese reactionaries to become a military power and attain their design for overseas expansion with the backing of the United States, siding with its strategy.
   His remarks about Japan's support for the U.S. troops indicate that in case they are engaged in military intervention and aggression, Japan will also take part in them, irrespective of their location.
   The Japanese reactionaries have stepped up arms buildup since their defeat in the war. 
As a result, Japan ranks among the strongest military nations in the world with huge military potentials and attack weapons. 
   What remains to be done is for Japan to create a condition for justifying its military operations abroad. 
Its aim is to dispatch the "self-defense forces" to wherever the U.S. troops are to take military actions. 
   In other words, it intends to use its strength in all parts of the world on the plea of supporting the U.S. troops.
   The overseas expansion of the Japanese reactionaries will only lead to their self-destruction.
   They would be well advised to abandon the reckless overseas expansion design and seek a peaceful way.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun on shameless address of  Kim Young Sam
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun on shameless address of Kim Young Sam 
   Pyongyang, March 20 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun today comments on an "address" made by the traitor Kim Young Sam before newly-appointed high-ranking officials of the "New Korea Party" (NKP) including its chairman in an attempt to improve the image of the party, which is doomed to ruin owing to the retrogressive revision of evil laws and the Hanbo incident.
   The south Korean people are turning their back on the corrupted and depraved "NKP", the analyst of the paper says, and continues:
   Ridiculous is the rigmarole of Kim Young Sam that the "NKP" is a "clean political force". it is nothing but a sophism to beautify the fascist political party which is as corrupt as he is.
   Just as Kim young Sam is like a dead body, so the "NKP," his private party, is doomed to ruin.
   No matter how desperately he may try to save the dying "civilian"-veiled government, it is useless.
   It is only too natural that public opinion at home and abroad brands the "address" of Kim Young Sam as a prelude to a dirge for a funeral ceremony of Kim Young Sam and the "NKP".

articles.title: Press review
articles.content:
Press review 
   Pyongyang, March 20 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun today reports that Secretary  Kim Jong Il sent replies to the foreign state and Party leaders who wished him happy birthday.
   Papers carry news that preparatory committees for commemorating the 85th birthday of the great leader President Kim Il Sung were formed with due ceremonies in Pakistan and Uganda.
   Rodong Sinmun says that upon hearing the news that Secretary Kim Jong Il, Supreme Commander of the Korean People's Army (KPA111inspected KPA unit 834 entitled Kum Song lifeguard, officers and men of the people's army are resolved to defend the headquarters of the revolution at the risk of life.
   The press gives an account of a national seminar held in Pyongyang to mark the 80th anniversary of the Korean National Association organised by Kim Hyong Jik, an outstanding leader of the movement for liberation of the korean nation.
   Rodong Sinmun in a signed article says that Kim Hyong Jik's noble  idea of aim high will be everlasting with the advance of the Korean revolution.
   Econews of the press introduces a railway project between Wonsan and Mt. Kumgang promoted in the stage of completion and fulfilment of plans for the first quarter of this year at factories in different sectors of the national economy.
   Given in the press is an account of talks between the DPRK and the United States held in the United States.
   Rodong Sinmun in a commentary denounces the traitor Kim Young Sam for praising the corrupt "New Korea Party" and Minju Joson brands an "apology" of Kim Hyon Chloe, son of Kim Young Sam, as a political false drama.
   Rodong Sinmun carries a statement made by the north headquarters of the national alliance of youth and students for the country's reunification denouncing the south Korean puppet agency for national security planning for trying to disunite the south Korean federation of university student councils.
   True colours of Kim Hyon Chloe, a behind-the-scenes person in the Hanbo incident, cannot be concealed, the paper stresses in an article.
   A commentary of Rodong Sinmun denounces the Japanese government for trying to intensify supply assistance for overseas-based U.S. troops.
   The paper carries an article on Japan's ulterior intention concerning establishment of TMD system.

articles.title: National seminar marks 80th anniversary of KNA
articles.content:
National seminar marks 80th anniversary of KNA 
   Pyongyang, March 20 (KCNA) -- A national seminar was held in Pyongyang on Wednesday to mark the 80th anniversary of the Korean National Association (KNA).
   The KNA was formed by Kim Hyong Jik, an outstanding leader of the Korean national-liberation movement.
   Present at the seminar were Vice-President Pak Song Chloe, member of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, and Choe Thae Bok, alternate member of the Political Bureau and Secretary of the WPK Central Committee.
   Speakers said that the formation of the KNA was a historic declaration that the Korean anti-Japanese national-liberation movement broke with bourgeois nationalism, which had suffered many a setback, and changed its course to communism, with the policy of proletarian revolution suggested under the energetic leadership of Kim Hyong Jik.
   They stressed that for its right view of a true life, Kim Hyong Jik's idea of "Aim High" served as an ideological and mental support and a banner of national salvation in that it provided the anti-Japanese independence  fighters and people with firm confidence in the liberation of the country and in revolutinary victory. 
   The idea of "Aim High" could shine bright thanks to the Juche idea founded by the great leader President Kim Il Sung and it has been enriched by the respected General Kim Jong Il, a great master of ideology and theory.
   They noted that Kim Hyong Jik's idea of making the revolution generation after generation is a precious treasure in accomplishing the revolutionary cause of the leader and that the idea has been inherited and enriched by the President's idea of continuous revolution and the General's theory of inheritance. 
   The Korean revolution initiated by Kim Hyong Jik and consolidated by the President will be carried forward generation after generation as it is led by General Kim Jong Il, the speakers emphasized.

articles.title: S. Korean foreign debt totals dlrs 111 billion
articles.content:
S. Korean foreign debt totals dlrs 111 billion 
   Pyongyang, March 20 (KCNA) -- A total foreign debt of 1111h Korea reached  111 billion dollars as at the end of  last year, according to a Sseoul-based radio report.
    The south Korean foreign exchange "authority" said this on Mar. 17, adding that the foreign debt increased 32.6 billion dollars last year.
   South Korea has turned into a debtor nation saddled with the heaviest foreign debt of more than 2 million won per capita.

articles.title: Another crime of Kim Hyon Chloe disclosed
articles.content:
Another crime of Kim Hyon Chloe disclosed 
   Pyongyang, March 20 (KCNA) -- It has been brought to light in South Korea that Kim Hyon Chloe, son of the traitor Kim Young Sam, controled military personnel affairs, taking hold of a secret organization within the puppet army.
   Kim Hyon Chloe formed "mannahoe", a secret organization involving graduates of up to the 29th term from the puppet military academy, and named his confidants for important military posts to establish his footing in the army.
   He turned the "mannahoe" into his private organization. 
   He expelled Cchun Ddoo Hhwan's "hanahoe" from the "presidential" security service and national security advisor's office of "Chongwadae", the "capital security command," and the personnel affairs staff of the army so as to implant "mannahoe" members.
   He also absorbed Roh Tae Woo's "nanumhoe" to expand his forces rapidly and, in actuality, took the reins of military 0ersonnel affairs.

articles.title: Clumsy political drama
articles.content:
Clumsy political drama
   Pyongyang, March 20 (KCNA --  Minju Joson today runs a commentary on the "apology" made by Kim Hyon Chloe, son of the traitor Kim Young Sam. 
   It is no more than a political drama to mislead public opinion and cover up his foul colors as a swindler, the news analyst stresses, and says:
   Kim Hyon Chol's "apology" itself is in question. 
His crimes can never be patched up with some words such as "apology". 
Because his case is the largest financial scandal ever in history, in which he, in collusion with his father, forced banks to grant a huge amount of loan to the Hanbo steel works and received much money in reward. He also intervened in personnel affairs of the puppet aministration and the "agency for national security planning" to draw water to his mill.
   It is the traitor Kim Young Sam who is wirepulling the case behind the scenes to bury his son's crimes in oblivion.
   The traitor, in a "statement to the people" made some time ago, prattled that his son should take a "legal responsibility" for the Hanbo incident if necessary. 
But in actuality, he is resorting to all means to cover up the crimes.
   Kim Young Sam and Kim Hyon Chloe should stop resorting to artifice to cover up their dirty colors and should frankly confess their crimes and face the stern judgement by the people.

articles.title: Idea of "Aim High" will shine forever, says Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Idea of "Aim High" will shine forever, says Rodong Sinmun
   Pyongyang, March 20 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun today dedicates a signed article to the 80th anniversary of the Korean National Association (KNA) formed by Kim Hyong Jik, an outstanding leader of the anti-Japanese national liberation movement in Korea, on March 23, 1917.
   His whole life was a sacred life of a great pioneer who ushered in a new path of the anti-Japanese national liberation movement of Korea with the idea of "Aim High" and a brilliant career of an ardent patriot and distinguished revolutionary who left a very valuable heritage of the revolution for the start of the Juche cause and its victorious advance on this road, the author of the article says, and continues:
   "aim high" is a great revolutionary idea that, if one is to achieve the independence of the country and victory of the revolution, he should have a lofty aim and fight it out generation after generation, surmounting obstacles and difficulties with his own efforts.
   In shaping and advancing the revolutionary cause of Juche, this idea served as an ideological and spiritual source of the Juche idea opening up a new phase of the Korean revolution and provided new revolutionaries of Korea with unbounded loyalty to the country and the people and with indomitable fighting spirit.
   "Aim High" was successfully realised by the respected leader President  Kim Il Sung.
   As long as the revolution continues, this idea will serve as an idea with eternal vitality and as the unique spirit and valuable asset of Kim Il Sung's nation which the Korean revolutionaries and people should inherit and accomplish through generations.
   The cause of the Korean revolution, which was started by comrade Kim Il Sung, true to the lofty idea of "Aim High", is being successfully carried forward and triumphantly advanced by the respected comrade Kim Jong Il.
   "Aim High" is an ideological and mental source which enables the Korean people to make a constant advance and triumph, breaking through obstacles and trials with an indomitable stamina and spirit.
   It is also an immortal banner which encourages the Korean people to tirelessly fight for the prosperity and development of their country and motherland with a revolutionary outlook on life that they should live today for tomorrow.
   It is their iron faith to adorn their daily life with creation and exploits, taking the noble outlook of Kim Hong Jjik on life as a motto of struggle and life.
   The Juche-type revolutionaries and people of Korea will more resolutely fight as the descendants of Kim Il Sung's nation true to the great idea of "Aim High" and bring a brighter future of their country.
